Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Slightly \Slight"ly\, adv. 1. In a slight manner. [1913 Webster]
2. Slightingly; negligently. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]

slightly adv 1: to a small degree or extent; "his arguments were somewhat self-contradictory"; "the children argued because one slice of cake was slightly larger than the other" [syn: {somewhat}] 2: in a slim or slender manner; "a slenderly built woman"; "slightly built" [syn: {slenderly}, {slimly}]
